properties.caption: "Wooden spoons in the face of your bullets / And at the curfew? CACEROLAZO." © Eric Zolov.
A stencil on the Arzobispo Bridge reads: "Copper for Chile / NOT for the Military." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"DIGNITY"—a graffiti banner in the Bellas Artes neighborhood. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"For all the grandparents who committed suicide so as not to be a burden / 'Today the people rise up in your memory.'" © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Alive they took them / Alive we want them back." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Yoshua Osorio / 17 years old / Disappeared and found burnt to ashes at the Kayser de Penca store." © Eric Zolov.
"Cardenio Prado / Run over during a peaceful demonstration against social injustices." © Eric Zolov.
"Kevin Gómez Morgado / Assassinated by the military on October 21 2019 in Coquimbo." © Eric Zolov.
"NO MORE IMPUNITY": a massive graphic mural near the Baquedano subway station. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"They torture in $hile." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"CHILE IS NOT FOR SALE." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"It’s not 30 pesos / It's 30 years." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Chile—if happiness doesn’t come we will go looking for it." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
Graffiti in Ñuñoa equating the regimes of Pinochet and Piñera. © Eric Zolov.
"Piñera or Pinochet? I don’t know Rick... They look the same." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
A stencil referencing the movie "Back to the Future" (1985). © Eric Zolov.
A 1978 photograph of Pinochet aligned with a widely circulated image of Piñera. © Eric Zolov.
"210 wounded by weapons / 18 dead." © Eric Zolov.
"Torture is happening in Chile [in] 2019." © Eric Zolov.
"Ciao Chicago Boys!" a glib graffiti on the MetLife Insurance building. © Eric Zolov.
